title: 1963–64 in Israeli football
text:
The 1963–64 season was the 16th season of competitive <a href="Association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Israel">Israel</a> and the 38th season under the <a href="Israeli%20Football%20Association">Israeli Football Association</a>, established in 1928, during the <a href="Mandatory%20Palestine">British Mandate</a>.
Domestic leagues.
Promotion and relegation.
The following promotions and relegations took place at the end of the season:
Domestic cups.
<a href="Israel%20State%20Cup">Israel State Cup</a>.
The <a href="1963%E2%80%9364%20Israel%20State%20Cup">1963–64 Israel State Cup</a>, which stated on 21 September 1963, was delayed by a series of appeals on third round results which were settled only by June 1963, forcing the competition to be carried over to the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20in%20Israeli%20football">next season</a>.
National Teams.
<a href="Israel%20national%20football%20team">National team</a>.
<a href="Football%20at%20the%201964%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20qualification">1964 Summer Olympics qualification</a>.
The national team competed in the Asian zone of the <a href="1964%20Summer%20Olympics">1964 Summer Olympics</a> qualification and was drawn to play <a href="South%20Vietnam%20national%20football%20team">South Vietnam</a> in the first round. After winning 1–0 in <a href="Saigon">Saigon</a>, Israel suffered a shock 0–2 defeat in <a href="Ramat%20Gan%20Stadium">Ramat Gan</a> and was eliminated from qualification.
